text.0: here by ordainers was this god appointed first invoker best at worship to be praised at rites.
text.1: whom apnavāna and the bhṛgus caused to shine brightcoloured in the wood spreading from home to home.
text.2: when shall thy glory as a god agni be suddenly shown forth.
text.3: for mortal men have held thee fast adorable in all their homes.
text.4: seeing thee faithful to the law most sapient like the starry heaven.
text.5: illumining with cheerful ray each solemn rite in every house.
text.6: vivasvāns envoy living men have taken as their ensign swift.
text.7: the ruler over all mankind moving like bhṛgu in each home.
text.8: him the intelligent have they placed duly as invoking priest.
text.9: welcome with sanctifying flame best worshipper with sevenfold might.
text.10: in his eternal mothers in the wood concealed and unapproached.
text.11: kept secret though his flames are bright seeking on all sides quickly found.
text.12: that as food spreads forth in this earthly udder gods may rejoice them in the home of order.
text.13: great agni served with reverence and oblation flies ever to the sacrifice the faithful.
text.14: bird of each rite skilled in an envoys duties knowing both worlds and that which lies between them.
text.15: thou goest from of old a willing herald knowing full well heavens innermost recesses.
text.16: bright god thy path is black light is before thee thy moving splendour is the chief of wonders.
text.17: when she yet unimpregnate hath conceived thee even when newly born thou art an envoy.
text.18: yet newly born his vigour is apparent when the wind blows upon his fiery splendour.
text.19: his sharpened tongue he layeth on the brushwood and with his teeth een solid food consumeth.
text.20: when he hath borne off food with swift flame swiftly strong agni makes himself a speedy envoy.
text.21: follows the rustling of the wind consuming and courserlike speeds drives the swift horse onward.
